question:
[Question]:
A student performed the following investigation to test four different polymer plastics for stretchability.
Procedure:
1. Take a sample of one type of plastic, and measure its length.
2. Tape the top edge of the plastic sample to a table so that it is hanging freely down the side of the table.
3. Attach a clamp to the bottom edge of the plastic sample.
4. Add weights to the clamp and allow them to hang for five minutes.
5. Remove the weights and clamp, and measure the length of the plastic types.
6. Repeat the procedure exactly for the remaining three plastic samples.
7. Perform a second trial (T2) exactly like the first trial (T1).
The student recorded the following data from the investigation.
Data Table:
| Plastic Type | Amount Stretched T1 (mm) | Amount Stretched T2 (mm) |
| A | 10 | 12 |
| B | 22 | 23 |
| C | 14 | 13 |
| D | 20 | 20 |
 a. Draw a conclusion based on the studentâ€™s data.
b. Describe two ways the student could have improved the experimental design and/or validity of the results.
key_elements_original:
[Key Answer Elements]:
Experimental Design Improvements:
Provide the before and after measurements for length (Did the samples all start out the same size?).
Make sure the samples are all of the same thickness. Variations in thickness could have caused variations in stretchability.
Perform additional trials. Some of the samples have similar stretchability (A and C, B and D). Two trials may not be enough to conclusively state that one is more stretchable than the other.
Indicate how many weights were added to the clamps (Was it the same number for each sample?).
Conclusions:
Plastic sample B has more stretchability than the other polymer plastics.
Plastic sample A has the least amount of stretchability compared to the other polymer plastics.
Not all polymer plastics have the same stretchability.
Different polymer plastics have different stretchability (and are therefore suited for different applications).
A reasonable conclusion cannot be drawn due to procedural errors.

rubric:
[Marking Rubric]:
3 points; The response draws a valid conclusion supported by the student's data and describes two ways the student could have improved the experimental design and/or the validity of the results.
 2 points; The response draws a valid conclusion supported by the student's data and describes one way the student could have improved the experimental design and/or the validity of the results. -or- The response describes two ways the student could have improved the experimental design and/or the validity of the results but fails to draw or incorrectly draws a conclusion from the student's data.
 1 point; The response draws a valid conclusion supported by the student's data but fails to describe, or incorrectly describes, how the student could have improved the experimental design and/or the validity of the results. -or- The response describes one way the student could have improved the experimental design and/or the validity of the results but fails to draw or incorrectly draws a conclusion from the student's data.
 0 points; The response provides little or no correct information from the polymer investigation.
 Please assess the student answer with a score based on the above marking rubric: 
{{demonstation}}
[Student Answer]: "{{student_answer}}"
[Mark]:

key_elements:
[Student Answer]: "a) In trial 1, the plastic type A wrap streched 10mm, the plastic type B wrap streched 22 mm, the plastic Type C wrap streched 14 mm and the plastic Type D wrap streched 20 mm. In trail 2, the A wrap streched 12 mm, the B wrap streched 23 mm, the C wrap stretched 13 mm, and the D wrap stretched 20 mm. b) The student could have improved the validity if tge results by stretching the plastic wraps to see which one stretched the longest."
[Decision]: No 
[Student Answer]: "The conclusion of this lab is that plastic B stretched the most. The student could have improved the experimental design by saying what type of plastic they used, and how high the table was that the plastic was hanging from."
[Decision]: No 
[Student Answer]: "I can draw from the students experiment that plastic type B was the strongest besed upon the data. One way that the student could have improved his investigation could be to give a specific length to cut the plastic pieces into as well as ti put into this procedure how much of the plastic should have been on the table where it was taped. These two changes could have made a ore clear experimental procedure."
[Decision]: Yes 
[Student Answer]: "Based on the students data, plastic type B stretched the most, plastic type D stretched the second most, plastic type C stretched the third most, and plastic type A stretched the least. Two ways that the students could have improved the experimental design/validity of the results are having a set weight of the weights added every 5 mintues, have a set length for the plastics at the start of the test."
[Decision]: Yes
